item.title: [Pi] Teleport [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:8, topic:509238”]You guys are stupid…

Make sure the teleAction variable has the right value. You should be assigned a value to that variable every time it gets clicked and then you’re checking if that variable has a value of ## and if so, perform action, else it will just continue.[/quote]

We’re obviously not stupid. Me and Smok3r worked on this for awhile and we tried everything and couldn’t get it to work. Of course we tried what you said, only a complete idiot wouldn’t think to do that. Every other teleport that I made worked so, I’m not stupid. Thanks for nothing bruh.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Teleport [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

You guys are stupid…

Make sure the teleAction variable has the right value. You should be assigned a value to that variable every time it gets clicked and then you’re checking if that variable has a value of ## and if so, perform action, else it will just continue.

Read full topic

item.title: [Pi] Teleport [Pi]
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Hey guys, I added the “More” option to my teleports and I got it to work. It takes you to a page that says Woodcutting & under it it says Agility. Whenever you click those, they don’t take you anywhere. I added this to try to make them work but nothing happens.

case 9158: if (c.teleAction == 5) { c.getPA().spellTeleport(2480,3437,0); }

There’s stuff below that but it’s a long case, and I also added this.

} else if (c.teleAction == 5) { c.getPA().spellTeleport(3720,3457,0); }

I added that in case 9157:, does anybody have any ideas?

Read full topic
